details:
Several vulnerabilities were fixed in the fig2dev utilities for converting XFig figure files.


* [CVE-2020-21529](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-21529)
Stack buffer overflow in bezier\_spline().
* [CVE-2020-21531](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-21531)
Global buffer overflow in conv\_pattern\_index().
* [CVE-2020-21532](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-21532)
Global buffer overflow in setfigfont().
* [CVE-2020-21676](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-21676)
Stack-based buffer overflow in genpstrx\_text().
* [CVE-2021-32280](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-32280)
NULL pointer dereference in compute\_closed\_spline().


For Debian 10 buster, these problems have been fixed in version
1:3.2.7a-5+deb10u5.


We recommend that you upgrade your fig2dev packages.


For the detailed security status of fig2dev please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/fig2dev>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
